page.title: 02Penlee Lifeboat (Mousehole)
page.content: Four years ago there was a great disaster for some families in {Mousehole.}The{Penlee Lifeboat,}the "Solomon Browne", was lost with all hands. It was called out to rescue the crew of the S.S. "Union Star" which had lost all power in{Mounts Bay } during a very violent storm and was being blown towards the cliffs. No one really knows what happened on the night of 19th.Dec.1981 because there were no survivors from either boat. The new lifeboat the "Mabel Alice", donated by Mr. David Robinson, is stationed in Newlyn Harbour because it is an Arun class boat and will not fit in the old lifeboat house. In 1985 the Mayor of{Penzance } opened a memorial garden, built by the side of the old lifeboat house, in memory of the eight crewmen of the "Solomon Browne".
